intro: Goniolimon crispum, commonly known as the brittle stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
